text: Colorado's 20th Senate district is one of 35 districts in the Colorado Senate. It has been represented by Democrat Jessie Danielson since 2019, succeeding independent incumbent Cheri Jahn. ==Geography== District 20 covers the immediate western suburbs of Denver in Jefferson County, including Applewood, Wheat Ridge, and parts of Arvada and Lakewood. The district is largely based in Colorado's 7th congressional district, with small pieces extending into the 1st and 2nd congressional districts. It overlaps with the 22nd, 23rd, 24th, 25th, 27th, and 28th districts of the Colorado House of Representatives. ==Recent election results== Colorado Senators are elected to staggered four- year terms; under normal circumstances, the 20th district holds elections in midterm years. ===2018=== ===2014=== ===Federal and statewide results in District 20=== {| class=wikitable |- ! width="30" | Year ! width="60" | Office ! width="180" | Results |- | 2018 | Governor | align="right" | Polis 55.1 – 40.9% |- | 2016 | President | align="right" | Clinton 50.0 – 41.1% |- | rowspan="2" | 2014 | Senate | align="right" | Udall 48.1 – 46.3% |- | Governor | align="right" | Hickenlooper 51.8 – 43.7% |- | 2012 | President | align="right" | Obama 51.6 – 46.0% |} == References == 20 Category:Jefferson County, Colorado
title: Colorado's 20th Senate district
